koohiiStory1: In the West, people have no value. Only money is important.
koohiiStory2: What might it mean for a person in the old west to be of value? Their face is on a "Wanted!" poster, of course. Imagine the reward...
words:
価格(かかく): price, value, cost
価値(かち): value, worth, merit
高価(こうか): high price
定価(ていか): established price
評価(ひょうか): valuation, estimation, assessment, evaluation
物価(ぶっか): prices of commodities, prices (in general), cost-of-living
